intro: Sonchus nitidus, commonly known as the glossy groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, waxy coating, giving them a glossy appearance. Sonchus nitidus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
